channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Bitcoin inches closer to a 10-year record, as other stats turn bullish
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Right now, Bitcoin is a day away from matching a nearly 10-year-old record and Ethereum could hit a significant milestone by Q2.

item.title: Tucker Carlson outlines wild theory to explain Bitcoin price rise: 'Maximum tin foil'
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Members of Crypto Twitter were quick to mock Tucker Carlson, who provided no supporting evidence to back his claims.

item.title: Number of devs increased during crypto winter: Electric Capital report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Ethereum continues to be the dominant blockchain for developer activity, however, a few other chains continued to make ground.

item.title: Crypto stocks surge: Coinbase up 69%, MicroStrategy up 74% since lows
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: Crypto-related stocks, ETFs and tokens have all surged in price so far in 2023 despite experts expecting the Federal Reserve to continue hiking interest rates.

item.title: 'There will be many more zeros' — Kevin O'Leary on FTX-like collapses to come
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Felix Ng
item.description: The Shark Tank star said all unregulated exchanges are seeing “massive outflows” right now, and rightly so.

item.title: Crypto recruitment execs reveal the safest jobs amid layoff season
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: The crypto industry has already seen more than 1,600 layoffs across the industry in the first two weeks of January.

item.title: Are we still mad at MetaMask and ConsenSys for snooping on us?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By J.W. Verret
item.description: ConsenSys, the developer behind MetaMask, isn’t the only one snooping on our transactions, but they’ve taken the most heat for it.

item.title: FTX: It took ‘Herculean investigative effort’ to identify $5.5B in liquid assets
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Debtors said they had identified $1.7 billion in cash, $3.5 billion in crypto assets and $0.3 billion in securities following FTX filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy.

item.title: WEF publishes new in-depth guide to DAOs to air issues, encourage development
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The World Economic Forum’s “Decentralized Autonomous Organization Toolkit” is the fruit of the labor of over 100 experts in a concise discussion format.

item.title: WEF panel discusses the coming tokenized economy
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The panel included the CEO of Circle, Finland’s minister of transport and communications, and other industry personalities.

item.title: Bitcoin price strength intensifies as risk-loving traders bring volume back to the crypto market
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.description: An increase in Bitcoin trading volume and positive on-chain data appear to be the primary forces behind BTC’s newfound strength.

item.title: SEC leaked crypto miners’ personal information during investigation: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The financial regulator reportedly unintentionally included 650 names and email addresses in communications with blockchain firm Green as part of an investigation.

item.title: Bitcoin holds $20K while flirting with a neutral futures premium for the first time in 6 months
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Global and U.S. economic data and a few BTC derivatives-related metrics could determine whether Bitcoin retests the $20,000 level in the short-term.

item.title: Bitcoin on-chain and technical data begin to suggest that the BTC price bottom is in
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Nivesh Rustgi
item.description: BTC’s uncanny resemblance with the last two market cycles raises the possibility that the bottom could be in, but full confirmation is dependent on on-chain data.

item.title: Price analysis 1/17: SPX, DXY, BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, DOGE, ADA, MATIC, DOT
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin’s chart shows a tug-of-war between bulls and bears, and this is having a slight impact on the upward price action of most altcoins.

item.title: Is this a bull run or a bull trap? Watch The Market Report live
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Adrian J. Permal
item.description: On this week’s episode of The Market Report, Cointelegraph’s resident experts discuss whether the recent price rally is a bull run or a bull trap.

item.title: ‘To the moon’ or ‘total crash’? Bitcoin price hits new 4-month highs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: BTC price action is still splitting consensus regarding whether Bitcoin will continue higher — what do you think?

item.title: Masa Finance launches soulbound Web3 identity protocol for Ethereum
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: According to the developers, the soulbound credit score system uses over 10,000 data points to determine a Web3 user’s creditworthiness.

item.title: Hong Kong investment fund raises $500M to push mass adoption in Web3
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The global asset manager HashKey Capital closed the funding round for its FinTech Investment Fund III, with which it plans to invest in startups and projects in the space perpetuating mass adoption.

item.title: Polygon enlists Xternity to migrate multiplayer Web3 game from Solana
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: To help transfer Synergy Land’s resources onto the EVM chain, Xternity proposed a process — via its network migration tool — that can be used to migrate games or projects across chains.

item.title: Africa Web3 games publisher Carry1st raises $27M
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Sam Bourgi
item.description: VC firms Bitkraft Ventures and Andreessen Horowitz participated in the funding round, which aims to advance Web3 gaming in Africa.

item.title: 10 practices crypto can borrow from TradFi to better protect customers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph Innovation Circle
item.description: The crypto industry would be wise to learn from and adopt the proven principles and processes TradFi relies on to protect consumers.

item.title: How to resurrect the ‘Metaverse dream’ in 2023
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jillian Godsil

item.title: ‘I thought SBF was the Mark Zuckerberg of crypto,’ says Anthony Scaramucci
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joseph Hall
item.description: The SkyBridge Capital co-founder said blockchain “skepticism is usually born from a lack of knowledge,” while sharing that his crypto holdings include Bitcoin, Ether, Solana and Algorand.

item.title: Silvergate reports $1B net loss in the fourth quarter of 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The report highlighted that deposits in the fourth quarter were $7.3 billion, which was lower than the third quarter figure of $12 billion.

item.title: Bitcoin DeFi ecosystem explained
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jagjit Singh
item.description: DeFi on Bitcoin was made possible by the Taproot upgrade. Find out how Bitcoin DeFi works compared to the Ethereum blockchain.

item.title: Bitcoin hits new post-FTX high as analysis warns move ‘choreographed’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: The current BTC price boost may not be a natural phenomenon any longer, new research says.

item.title: SEC of Thailand issues crypto custody provider rules
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: The Thai securities regulator now requires crypto custodians to have a contingency plan in case of unforeseen events.

item.title: Troubled crypto lender Vauld gets extended creditor protection
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: The company claims that the negotiations with potential crisis managers entered the “advanced stage.”

item.title: Crypto mining stocks surge to yearly highs after Bitcoin bounces back
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: The surge in crypto mining stocks was a relief for the industry after a crippling year, where public crypto miners incurred $4 billion in liabilities.
